::: {.question-block}

<form onsubmit="event.preventDefault(); checkAnswer('module5_mcq_q55')" data-correct-answer="D">
<strong style="display: block;">Using the Fama-French three-factor model, compute the expected return of a stock with the following characteristics:  
Rf = 2%, βm = 1.1, βSMB = 0.3, βHML = 0.4.  
The factor premia are: E[Rm−Rf] = 6%, E[RSMB] = 2%, E[RHML] = 3%.</strong>

<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q55" value="A"> A. 9.2%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q55" value="B"> B. 10.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q55" value="C"> C. 10.5%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q55" value="D"> D. 11.0%</label><br>
<label><input type="radio" name="module5_mcq_q55" value="E"> E. 11.5%</label><br>
</form>

<div id="feedback-module5_mcq_q55" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
✅ Correct: D.  
E[R] = Rf + βm × (Rm−Rf) + βSMB × E[RSMB] + βHML × E[RHML]  
= 2% + 1.1×6% + 0.3×2% + 0.4×3%  
= 2% + 6.6% + 0.6% + 1.2% = 11.0%.
</div>

:::
